description: Write a program that inputs a year number and checks if it's a leap year. If it is, print LEAP, otherwise print COMMON. - A year is a leap year if its number is exactly divisible by 4 and is not exactly divisible by 100. - A year is always a leap year if its number is exactly divisible by 400. Note that the words LEAP and COMMON should be printed all caps.
correct-program:
# Input year number year = int(input("Enter a year: "))
# Check if the year is a leap year if (year % 4 == 0 and year % 100 != 0) or (year % 400 == 0): print("LEAP") else: print("COMMON")
